search_information.query_displayed: Athletics and Social Participation in the Educational Attainment Process Hanks, Michael P. Eckland, Bruce K. Sociology of Education

organic_results.title: Athletics and social participation in the educational attainment process
organic_results.snippet: High school and college models were developed to assess the role of the extracurricular program in the educational attainment process which distinguished between participation in athletics and other activities. The models were evaluated separately for males and females using longitudinal data from a national sample of youth who were high school sophomores in 1955. Athletics was found to have very weak antecedents and consequences. Social participation had relatively strong direct and total salutary effects on academic performance …

publication_info.summary: MP Hanks, BK Eckland - Sociology of Education, 1976 - JSTOR
